question: Mouth really swollen after wisdom teeth extraction, HELP?
question_content: I got all 4 pulled out yesterday morning. The doctor told me to put ice on my face near where the wisdom teeth were. I never put ice, and now I think that's why they are so swollen. Anyways he told me to eat normal food, but I can't because its so swollen. Should I just bare the pain and chew down on my missing teeth. Or will it do harm? What is moist heat? I heard it helps the swelling go down, because ice doesn't work after 36 hours.

answers.answer_content:
I never ate anything the first 24 hours and never used an ice pack
Didn't he give you Tylenol3 or Ibuprophen for pain and swelling?
Never eat right away.. you might catch food in the openings where the stitches
are drink things like water, milk, nothing solid
Call your dentist it should be better in 48 hours not worse!

moist heat means that there is humidity in the air. You can accomplish this by sitting in the bathroom and turning the water on hot and basking in the steam. I wouldn't chew on the missing teeth if they hurt that bad, because you'll have to clean the holes out and that would hurt worse. Did you try eating applesauce?
